results.title: The Restless planet
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Earth revealed”.
The creation of the planets in our solar system has had an enormous impact on the geological structure of the Earth,and the existence of life on the planet. This episode examines the origins of the solar system and planets, and how the Earth and its atmosphere evolved. The Earth and its inter-relationship with the planets is also examined.

results.title: The Restless eye: Eugene Delacroix: a film based on his paintings and his journals
results.creator_credit: Colin Nears, RM Productions and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Born in France in 1798 and dying in 1863, Eugene Delacroix was one of the most important Romantic painters of his time, earning him the retrospective reputation of, ‘a painter’s painter’ - his work’s being referenced and copied by the likes of Manet, Picasso and Van Gogh. This documentary is based on the journals that Delacroix wrote since age 24 which have since become literary classics in their own right. The writings reveal much of Delacroix’s dilemmas and intentions in his life and art. He was sceptical of progress, disdainful of the masses and scornful of revolution, but also intended to articulate his fascination with the barbarity and violence of ‘humanity’. Declaring, “I’m trying to make a beauty which is not quiet”, Delacroix painted a heady mix of beauty and cruelty with constant movement, colour, and restless energy. Cast includes John Carson as Delacroix.

results.title: The Restless Earth
results.creator_credit: Sverides Radio Sweeden, Studio Hamburg, National Educational Television, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC
results.brief_description: Looks at the earth’s geological history in terms of the ”plate theory”, with particular reference to Britain. Discusses the movement of the plates carrying the continents, the formation of oceans and mountains, and the occurrence of earthquakes and volcanoes. Introduced by Magnus Magnusson and narrated by John Gregson. (This is the Australian version with Australians - Peter Ross and Keith Michell- as host and narrator).

results.title: The Restless conscience
results.brief_description: A detailed documentary on the resistance to Hitler in Germany before and during World War II. The network of anti-Nazi activity in Germany that was active in the military and within the SS ranks from Hitler’s rise to power and into the war is profiled through discussion, first of the efforts by military leaders to gain the support of foreign nations in overthrowing Hitler’s government, and then of the range of assassination attempts and networks to smuggle Jews and other persecuted groups and individuals from the country. Through a collection of interviews including those with surviving members of the resistance and the families of those they helped, archival footage, and a critical commentary the program is a thorough exploration of the principles behind the movement as well as their activities.

results.title: The responsive brain
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
The relationship between brain and behaviour is reciprocal. Although our behaviour is influenced by the brain, the brain can also be changed, quite literally, by behaviour. Philip Zimbardo takes, as examples of this change, the need for touch in infants, the lack of which can lead to impaired physical and mental development, and the effects of stress on our ability to learn and to grow.

results.title: The Respect Quest [game trailer]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Halse, Liam Blake and Tea Tree Gully Primary School
results.brief_description:
Time Monsters are spreading disrespect in the community and causing havoc. Help local villagers and elders restore respect by defeating the Time Monsters with a magic boomerang. Jump on platforms, collect coins and explore through the mountains of time. Money gained on the quest will help rebuild the villages after respect is restored.

This trailer illustrates how the game is played.
Under the category ‘Primary Games’, Tea Tree Gully Primary School’s Liam Blake and Christopher Halse, Grade 5, were the Screen It 2011 winners.

results.title: The Research director
results.creator_credit: Ronald Weyman, Morten Parker and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A description of the work of a research director of a United Steel Workers Union in Canada. The painstaking research and analyses of economic information, and the arrangement of arguments that lie beneath the negotiations of labour unions for better wages and working conditions are shown.

results.title: The Rescuers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Art Stevens, John Lounsbery, Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Courageous rescues are the speciality of secret agent mice, Bernard and Bianca. An innocent orphan named Penny is kidnapped by Madame Medusa, a wickedly wacky villainess. Madame Medusa needs Penny to recover a priceless jewel. Bernard and Bianca set out to save Penny from Madame Medusa’s evil clutches. Voices are provided by Bob Newhart, Eva Gabor and Geraldine Page. Animated.

results.title: The Rescuers
results.creator_credit: Art Stevens, John Lounsbery, Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Courageous rescues are the specialty of secret agent mice, Bernard and Bianca. An innocent orphan named Penny is kidnapped by Madame Medusa, a wickedly wacky villainess. Madame Medusa needs Penny to recover a priceless jewel. Bernard and Bianca set out to save Penny from Madame Medusa’s evil clutches. Voices are provided by Bob Newhart, Eva Gabor and Geraldine Page. Animated.
